model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Speaker A, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Speaker A: What instrument do you play? 
Speaker B: I don't know play instrument. Only  I enjoy rock music.
Speaker A: ah right, who's your favourite rock band?
Speaker B: I'm big fan of aerosmith. When do you learn music. Whom teach you?
Speaker A: aerosmith are great, have you ever seen them live? I have been playing drums since i was a kid, my father taught me when I was young and from then on I just taught myself
Speaker B: That's awesome! I have been trying to learn last one year. Still I didn't get right teacher. I'm jealous on you. I don't have like your dad.
Speaker A: what instrument have you been trying to learn?
Speaker B: Piano is my favorite instrument. When try play my mind was mesmerizing. How do you learn surfering?

[MEMORY]
Speaker B enjoys fishing and spending time near the ocean but doesn't have time to surf anymore due to working at a doctor's office. Speaker A enjoys surfing and music as a way to escape from daily life. Speaker B wishes they had time to go surfing and is considering getting lessons at a surf shop.
Speaker A grew up in California on the beach and loves morning surfing. Speaker A enjoys surfing and music as a way to escape from daily life. Speaker A grew up on the beach and is good at surfing, nicknamed "lil fishie". Speaker A enjoys eating fish, particularly salmon or tuna.
